# Kotlin File Instructions

- Follow standard Kotlin naming convention
- Use idiomatic Kotlin for class, object, and function definitions
- Prefer data classes for simple data containers
- Use 2 new lines between field assignment/declaration at class/object level.
- Use 2 new lines between every 3 statements/expressions. 
- A single statement/expression that spans more than 3 lines should be separated from the following statement or expression by 2 new lines.
- Use null safety and type inference as seen in the codebase
- Match error handling and logging patterns from existing code
- Use existing annotation and import styles
- Document code with KDoc comments matching the style found in the codebase
- For tests, use the same structure, naming, and assertion patterns as in existing test files
